result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane C Reeves was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CONCURRENT WITH ALL OTHER BONDS, NO CONTACT WITH DOROTHY PYNONNEN.

Defendant Shane C Reeves in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  Andrea Amidon Nodolf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CF91, 14CF101, 14CF102.   14CF86, 14CF91-Atty/DE will waive prelim hearings in all cases.  Court instructs on waiver of prelim, court is satisfied will accept waiver.  Court will find probable cause, will bind over for JT.  14CF101, 14CF102-Init App-  Waive formal reading of Criminal Complaint.  Atty/DE will also waive prelim hearings in these two cases.  Court instructs on time limits, is satisfied will accept waiver. Court will find probable cause and will bind over for JT.  All bonds will be concurrent, no contact with Dorothy Pynonnen in 14CF101 and Michael Tomaszewski in 14CF102. Atty prefers to do arraignment at a later date.  Will set for 11-03 @ 3:30 for all cases.
Arraignment on November 3, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
